key.substructure.key.doc.comment:
Checks to see if the `streamStatus` is any of the given statuses.

- Parameter statuses: the list of statuses.
- Returns: `true` if the current `streamStatus` is any of the given statuses.
key.substructure.key.doc.declaration: public func status(in statuses: Stream.Status...) -> Bool

key.substructure.key.doc.comment: If the stream has not yet been opened, open it and wait for it to be fully open - `streamStatus` != [Stream](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/stream/).Status.opening`.

key.substructure.key.annotated_decl: <Declaration>public func read(to buffer: <Type usr="s:7Rubicon12CCharPointera">CCharPointer</Type>, maxLength: <Type usr="s:Si">Int</Type>) throws -> <Type usr="s:Si">Int</Type></Declaration>
key.substructure.key.doc.comment: A better read function for [InputStream](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/inputstream/). THIS METHOD IS NOT THREAD SAFE!!!! This method reads from the stream in chunks so do not use this method while any other thread might be potentially reading from this stream at the same time or you will be missing data. - Parameters: - buffer: The buffer that will receive the bytes. - maxLength: The maximum number of bytes to read. - fully: `true` to keep reading until either maxLength or end-of-file is reached. - Returns: The total number of bytes read or [zero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/0) if `maxLength` is [zero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/0), the end-of-file has been reached, the stream is closed, or the stream was never opened. - Throws: Any error reported by the input stream.
key.substructure.key.doc.declaration: public func read(to buffer: CCharPointer, maxLength: Int) throws -> Int
key.substructure.key.doc.full_as_xml: read(to:maxLength:)s:So13NSInputStreamC7RubiconE4read2to9maxLengthSiSpys4Int8VG_SitKFpublic func read(to buffer: CCharPointer, maxLength: Int) throws -> IntA better read function for ]]>InputStream]]>. THIS METHOD IS NOT THREAD SAFE!!!! This method reads from the stream in chunks so do not use this method while any other thread might be potentially reading from this stream at the same time or you will be missing data.bufferinThe buffer that will receive the bytes.maxLengthinThe maximum number of bytes to read.fullyintrue to keep reading until either maxLength or end-of-file is reached.The total number of bytes read or ]]>zero]]> if maxLength is ]]>zero]]>, the end-of-file has been reached, the stream is closed, or the stream was never opened.Any error reported by the input stream.
key.substructure.key.doc.name: read(to:maxLength:)

key.substructure.key.annotated_decl: <Declaration>public func read(to data: inout <Type usr="s:10Foundation4DataV">Data</Type>, maxLength len: <Type usr="s:Si">Int</Type>, truncate clr: <Type usr="s:Sb">Bool</Type> = true) throws -> <Type usr="s:Si">Int</Type></Declaration>
key.substructure.key.doc.comment: A better read function for [InputStream](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/inputstream/). THIS METHOD IS NOT THREAD SAFE!!!! This method reads from the stream in chunks so do not use this method while any other thread might be potentially reading from this stream at the same time or you will be missing data. - Parameters: - data: The [Data](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/data/) to read the bytes into. - len: The maximum number of bytes to read or -1 to read all to the end-of-file. - clr: `true` to clear the data buffer before reading or `false` to append read data to the existing data. - Returns: The total number of bytes read or [zero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/0) if `len` is [zero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/0), the end-of-file has been reached, the stream is closed, or the stream was never opened. - Throws: Any error reported by the input stream.
key.substructure.key.doc.declaration: public func read(to data: inout Data, maxLength len: Int, truncate clr: Bool = true) throws -> Int

THIS METHOD IS NOT THREAD SAFE!!!! This method reads from the stream in chunks so do not use this method while any other thread might be potentially reading from this stream at the same time or you will be missing data.datainThe ]]>Data]]> to read the bytes into.leninThe maximum number of bytes to read or -1 to read all to the end-of-file.clrintrue to clear the data buffer before reading or false to append read data to the existing data.The total number of bytes read or ]]>zero]]> if len is ]]>zero]]>, the end-of-file has been reached, the stream is closed, or the stream was never opened.Any error reported by the input stream.

key.doc.result_discussion.Para: The total number of bytes read or if `len` is , the end-of-file has been reached, the stream is closed, or the stream was never opened.

key.substructure.key.doc.comment: Read bytes into an instance of `EasyByteBuffer`. This method assumes that the `EasyByteBuffer.count` field is being used to store the number of bytes in the buffer. The newly read bytes will be appended to the end of the existing bytes, as denoted by the value in the `EasyByteBuffer.count` field. If `EasyByteBuffer.count` is less than [zero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/0) (0) or greater than `EasyByteBuffer.length` then a fatalError is thrown. If `EasyByteBuffer.count` is equal to `EasyByteBuffer.length` then this method returns immediately with the value [zero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/0) (0). - Parameter b: the `EasyByteBuffer` that will be used to store the bytes read. - Returns: The number of bytes read into the buffer or [zero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/0) (0) if the buffer is full or the stream it at EOF or -1 if there was an I/O error.
key.substructure.key.doc.declaration: public func read(to b: MutableManagedByteBuffer) throws -> Int
key.substructure.key.doc.full_as_xml: read(to:)s:So13NSInputStreamC7RubiconE4read2toSiAC24MutableManagedByteBuffer_p_tKFpublic func read(to b: MutableManagedByteBuffer) throws -> IntRead bytes into an instance of EasyByteBuffer. This method assumes that the EasyByteBuffer.count field is being used to store the number of bytes in the buffer. The newly read bytes will be appended to the end of the existing bytes, as denoted by the value in the EasyByteBuffer.count field. If EasyByteBuffer.count is less than ]]>zero]]> (0) or greater than EasyByteBuffer.length then a fatalError is thrown. If EasyByteBuffer.count is equal to EasyByteBuffer.length then this method returns immediately with the value ]]>zero]]> (0).binthe EasyByteBuffer that will be used to store the bytes read.The number of bytes read into the buffer or ]]>zero]]> (0) if the buffer is full or the stream it at EOF or -1 if there was an I/O error.
key.substructure.key.doc.name: read(to:)

discussion.Para: the `EasyByteBuffer` that will be used to store the bytes read.

key.doc.result_discussion.Para: The number of bytes read into the buffer or (0) if the buffer is full or the stream it at EOF or -1 if there was an I/O error.

key.substructure.key.name: read(to:)
key.substructure.key.parsed_declaration: public func read(to b: MutableManagedByteBuffer) throws -> Int

key.doc.discussion.Para: Calling this property directly is discouraged. Instead, convert an instance of any type to a string by using the `String(describing:)` initializer. This initializer works with any type, and uses the custom `description` property for types that conform to `CustomStringConvertible`:
The conversion of `p` to a string in the assignment to `s` uses the `Point` type’s `description` property.

key.substructure.key.doc.full_as_xml: <Other><Name>description</Name><USR>s:s23CustomStringConvertibleP11descriptionSSvp</USR><Declaration>var description: String { get }</Declaration><CommentParts><Abstract><Para>A textual representation of this instance.</Para></Abstract><Discussion><Para>Calling this property directly is discouraged. Instead, convert an instance of any type to a string by using the <codeVoice>String(describing:)</codeVoice> initializer. This initializer works with any type, and uses the custom <codeVoice>description</codeVoice> property for types that conform to <codeVoice>CustomStringConvertible</codeVoice>:</Para><CodeListing language="swift"><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[struct Point: CustomStringConvertible {]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[    let x: Int, y: Int]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[    var description: String {]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[        return "(\(x), \(y))"]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[    }]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[}]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[let p = Point(x: 21, y: 30)]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[let s = String(describing: p)]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[print(s)]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered><![CDATA[// Prints "(21, 30)"]]></zCodeLineNumbered><zCodeLineNumbered></zCodeLineNumbered></CodeListing><Para>The conversion of <codeVoice>p</codeVoice> to a string in the assignment to <codeVoice>s</codeVoice> uses the <codeVoice>Point</codeVoice> type’s <codeVoice>description</codeVoice> property.</Para><Note><Para>This documentation comment was inherited from <codeVoice>CustomStringConvertible</codeVoice>.</Para></Note></Discussion></CommentParts></Other>
